cards.image_prompt:
A vertical children's educational card in 5:7 aspect ratio (1500x2100 pixels).

=== STYLE ===
Vivid, high-contrast cartoon style suitable for ages 4-6.
- Characters: Rounded, friendly shapes. Large expressive eyes.
- Lines: Thick, clean black outlines (2-3px equivalent).
- Contrast: High contrast between foreground and background.
- Complexity: Maximum 5-7 distinct visual elements per scene.

Card Format: 5x7 inches (1500x2100px)
Corners: rounded (8-10px radius)

Colors:
- Main elements: Bold primary colors
- Background: Soft warm cream/golden gradient

=== RESTRICTIONS ===
NEVER depict God in any human or physical form.
NEVER write God's name in Hebrew.
Use only: Warm golden/white light rays from above, glowing soft clouds.

=== CARD TYPE: ANCHOR (Full Bleed Parasha Introduction) ===

=== EXACT TEXT TO RENDER ===
Hebrew Title: "驻指旨专指砖址转 执转职专止"
English Title: "Parashat Yitro"
Emotional Hook: "This week is about feeling AWE - that's when something is SO amazing it makes you go WOW!"

=== CENTRAL SYMBOL ===
Two stone tablets with rounded tops, GLOWING with warm golden light.
Light rays stream down from soft clouds above.

IMPORTANT - Each tablet shows 5 Hebrew letters:
- Left tablet:     
- Right tablet:     
NEVER use God's name. Use alphabet letters only.

=== COMPOSITION ===
Layout (top to bottom):
1. HEBREW TITLE (top 15%): "驻指旨专指砖址转 执转职专止" in large beautiful Hebrew with nikud
2. ENGLISH TITLE (5%): "Parashat Yitro" below Hebrew
3. CENTRAL SYMBOL (55%): Two glowing tablets with Hebrew letters
   - Golden radiance emanating outward
   - Left tablet:     
   - Right tablet:     
4. EMOTIONAL HOOK (18%): "This week is about feeling AWE - that's when something is SO amazing it makes you go WOW!"
5. Small decorative stars around tablets

=== FRAME ===
- Rounded corners (8-10px radius)
- Border: #5c2d91 Royal Purple (8px width)
- Star icon in top-left corner

=== MOOD ===
Majestic, wondrous, exciting. Children should feel: "Wow, something AMAZING happened!"
cards.teacher_script: This is Parashat Yitro! Do you see those special tablets? They're going to have very important words on them. This week, we're going to feel AWE - that's when something is SO amazing that it makes us go 'Wow!' Let's practice: put your hands on your cheeks and say 'WOW!'

cards.character_description_en: Moses is the leader of the Jewish people. He helped them leave Egypt and now takes care of them in the desert. Moses works very hard to help everyone - he listens to people's problems all day long! He loves his family and his people so much that he never stops trying to help them. In this parasha, Moses learns an important lesson: even leaders need help sometimes!

cards.character_description_en: Yitro is Moses's father-in-law. That means he is the daddy of Moses's wife, Tzipporah! Yitro is like a wise grandfather - he has lived a long time and learned many things. He was a leader in his own land called Midian. When Yitro heard about all the amazing things God did for the Jewish people, he traveled through the desert to visit Moses. Yitro saw that Moses was working too hard and gave him very good advice!
